column4: just install the linux-firmware-nonfree package, that has the firmware for p54usb (it goes in /lib/firmware)
however, if this is natty, the device won't work unless you upgrade to linux-image-2.6.38-10 (which has the patch that fixes it)
....of course
packages.ubuntu.com has deb links?
yes

sorry, it seems the new kernel isn't on packages.ubuntu.com yet (or I can't find it), since it is still in proposed, but it is here: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/lucid/+package/linux-image-2.6.38-10-generic
oops, wrong link again, https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/natty/+package/linux-image-2.6.38-10-generic
you upgraded the kernel too?
all dmesg gets me is wlan0: direct probe to *ip* timed out after 3 tries
that makes me think you don't have the new kernel, because that is the bug that was patched (well a side effect of it anyway)
what is: uname -a;
oh, hold on
probably need to update grub, right?
the triggers should update it, but you can: sudo update-grub; to be sure
yeah, sorry, I mentioned later, it isn't on packages.ubuntu.com because it is in proposed, I have a link, one sec
oh, sorry. I was probably installing linux at the time and it got washed away by the famous #ubuntu flood :P
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/natty/+package/linux-image-2.6.38-10-generic choose i386 or amd64 at the bottom and it will be in the downloadable files on the next page
it was my fault for directing you to the wrong place in the first place :)
so I just need the image or does that include a kernel too?
linux-image packages are the kernels plus the modules
you may need the headers too if you use nvidia proprietary drivers (or something similar)
nope, I'm good there
